━   Department of Rural Studies and Sustainability

The IRO coordinates bilateral research and academic programmes of the centres/departments of Dev Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya with overseas Institutions/Universities through Memorandum of Understanding (MoU).

The Centre also conducts foreign language courses such as German, French and Japanese for students, researchers and faculty members to help to gain much proficiency in the language for higher studies or job opportunities in the respective countries. The Centre organizes special lectures and seminars by professors/experts from various foreign Universities/Institutions. These talks are very much essential to take up the innovations, research development, to modify or eliminate the existing old technologies. Guidelines to higher education with funding facilities in different countries are also given through these talks. The centre invites prominent visitors from various foreign Universities/Institutions to DSVV to discuss future collaboration. The international collaboration activities are made through these visits to discuss the collaboration possibilities of strengthening the bilateral academic and research cooperation. The centre does the pre-counselling work for admission of students under Foreign Nationals (FN), Non-Resident Indians (NRI), People of Indian Origin (PIO) and Children of Indian Workers in Gulf Countries (CIWGC) categories to Undergraduate and Postgraduate programs.

Step 2: Submission of the Form Submit any required documents and other information needed.   Step 3:Application under Review Your application will be reviewed by the admissions committee.   Step 4: Written Test The written test will be conducted at the declared date at the exam center allotted in case of offline or online to the applicant which will be mentioned in your admit card.   Step 5: Interview The interview round will be conducted at Dev Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar for candidates who are selected in the written entrance examination. Applicants are required to bring all their documents for verification in original.   Step 6: Documents Verification and submission Process Submission of the required documents along with the maintenance fee of the first semester. The payment of maintenance fee can be made through Online mode by the link provided on the university website.   Note:  1. B. Ed. applicants are eligible to apply for one additional program by filling a separate application form and paying the form fee. 2. Application Form Fees is Non- Refundable.                                        Application Form Instructions Follow these instructions carefully to complete the application form:  Program Selection: Choose the program or major you are applying for from the list provided. Personal Information: Provide accurate personal details including your full name, date of birth, contact information, and mailing address. Educational Background: Enter information about your educational history, including schools attended, degrees earned, and dates of attendance. Supporting Documents: Upload any required supporting documents such as NSS, NCC, Scout& Guide, BSGP and Any other Sports Document. /li> Review and Submit: Carefully review all entered information before submitting the application. Once submitted, you may not be able to make changes. Payment: There is an application fee, proceed to the payment section and complete the payment process. Confirmation: After submitting the application, you will receive a confirmation email with further instructions regarding the admission process timeline and next steps. Step 2: Submission of the Form Submit any required documents and other information needed.   Step 3:Application under Review Your application will be reviewed by the admissions committee.   Step 4: Written Test The written test will be conducted at the declared date at the exam center allotted in case of offline or online to the applicant which will be mentioned in your admit card.   Step 5: Interview The interview round will be conducted at Dev Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar for candidates who are selected in the written entrance examination. Applicants are required to bring all their documents for verification in original.   Step 6: Documents Verification and submission Process Submission of the required documents along with the maintenance fee of the first semester. The payment of maintenance fee can be made through Online mode by the link provided on the university website.   Note:  1. B. Ed. applicants are eligible to apply for one additional program by filling a separate application form and paying the form fee. 2. Application Form Fees is Non- Refundable.                                        Application Form Instructions Follow these instructions carefully to complete the application form:  Program Selection: Choose the program or major you are applying for from the list provided. Personal Information: Provide accurate personal details including your full name, date of birth, contact information, and mailing address. Educational Background: Enter information about your educational history, including schools attended, degrees earned, and dates of attendance. Supporting Documents: Upload any required supporting documents such as NSS, NCC, Scout& Guide, BSGP and Any other Sports Document. /li> Review and Submit: Carefully review all entered information before submitting the application. Once submitted, you may not be able to make changes. Payment: There is an application fee, proceed to the payment section and complete the payment process. Confirmation: After submitting the application, you will receive a confirmation email with further instructions regarding the admission process timeline and next steps. Center & Program Change: You can change center and program once you submit the form and form fees by paying Rs. 200/- for each                                Admissions Closed for the Session 2024-25.Application Form Fees is Non Refundable.
